dt: {bc}opposing or taking arms against a government or ruler

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}rebellis{/it}, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}bellum{/it} war, from Old Latin {it}duellum{/it}
shortdef: opposing or taking arms against a government or ruler
one who rebels or participates in a rebellion

dt: {bc}to oppose or disobey one in authority or control
{bc}to renounce and resist by force the authority of one's government
{bc}to act in or show opposition or disobedience

dt.t: {it}rebelled{/it} against the conventions of polite society

dt: {bc}to feel or exhibit anger or revulsion

shortdef: to oppose or disobey one in authority or control
to renounce and resist by force the authority of one's government
to act in or show opposition or disobedience

dt: {bc}a prolonged high-pitched yell often uttered by Confederate soldiers in the American Civil War

shortdef: a prolonged high-pitched yell often uttered by Confederate soldiers in the American Civil War
